title: Service
body: Where did I start lol. I had an appointment with a doctor for a condition that has now been diagnosed by a nurse who gave me my mammogram!! I have been in agony for years and not 1 doctor has shown any interest .I have at last seen a doctor who agreed with the nurse and am getting treatment. Trying to get an appointment by phone is ridiculous. I go in to do it. I really hope this centre can have a full overhaul and be better

title: So understanding of the worries of elderly…
body: My wife aged 77 arrived home at 3.30pm Friday from day out having had mug of very hot tea accidentally tipped over her in a restaurant scalding her forearm and leg.  Despite first aid at the restaurant, blisters larger that postage stamp were now forming on  her arm.  My wife was shocked, hurting, and trembling and in no condition for long wait in A&E, so at 3.45pm I rang Surgery and asked if a doctor might ring back with advice on best thing to do.  The receptionist suggested ringing 111, but when I explained my wife's condition she said a Dr would ring back.  Dr rang back within ten minutes and said to bring my wife over for 5.10.  Dr examined her and called in practice nurse who dressed the area and provide a supply of dressings and a further appointment the following Monday.

title: Absolutely appalling
body: Been waiting in ane since 2.15 this afternoon I am type 1 diabetic and cannot walk I am sat in a wheelchair on my own no one offered me a drink or anything to eat and the doctors have lost mu notes so not been seen yet its not 9.45 and still not been seen

title: Absolutely Non Caring Settings
body:
First of all - within past 2yrs/3yrs (from Covid-19 until now. 

My regular Dr, who did mostly good (who saw me monthlys aswell as phone calls) (then phone calls due to Covid-19 restrictions) until this.... When my regular Dr who left the Surgery - Service I've had now Basically Nothing, No Regular Appointments. 

Even now after Covid-19 Restrictions - still Extremely Bad Services Without Regular Appointments, Non Consistently Care. 


Second of all. 

November 2022.

My Enablement Support Worker phone up Dr Surgery, the worker Weren't Impress that we had to wait entire Week for like mh Assessment etc. 

A week later (without any Appointment Time apart from day) I had phone call from mh (Mental Health) nurse, I did inform that phone were breaking up at the beginning of consultation, mh Nurse did repeat what I said. Instead of saying right I will phone you back. The Mh Nurse kept on having consultation, I kept saying phone breaking up, half of the time I didn't get the gist what being said due to phone line still breaking up. Next second Phone line eventually cut off. Mh Nurse Did Not phone back at all. The call lasted approx under 5min.

I then informed the Worker who made the appointment for me - the Worker response were they felt disappointed, angry, frustrated - mainly on my behalf. 

The worker informed me that they (the worker) rang up surgery following day, asking for the Surgery to phone the worker up to discuss what happens etc. The surgery not phone the worker Back. In my eyes I bet that phone call back possible won't even happened. 



Verdict of this Surgery 

Absolutely Jokes, Non Caring, Non Consistent Care. Borderline on Rudeness, Lazy. 

This surgery gone much More Downhill Over The Years. I were with yourself at Ashgate from 2007 ish - I had Much Better Services Back Then. Even when Dr left for Maternity Leave or Leave to work somewhere else, each Regular Dr made sure I would received the same Kind Consistent Service with regular Appointments with different Dr (end up with another regular) til my Main  Regular come back after Maternity. 

Now 2022

I'm extremely seriously thinking of changing surgery.

title: Poor service
body:
Presented at a&ewith my father.. the service was poor didn’t know where to report. The  initial nurse hardly spoke to us and answered question without  asking for the correct info this was then reported incorrect on the form. 
The receptionist was moody and did not listen and got dob and allergy info incorrect. She was talking to patient behind us whilst being dealt with. 
There is no privacy to be initially triaged in the utc everyone In reception can hear personal info and medical concern. 
There’s no idea of any waiting time. 
Covid notices are out of date on display. 
And forms being used are out of date and not current for guidance on covid-19. This can be confusing. 
The technicians appear uninterested on presenting to the centre. 
There should be a receptionist on reception. 
Over poor first impressions.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body:
I had a face-to-face appointment on Friday 18 November regarding a recurring skin problem behind my right ear that had not healed up for 4 months. The doctor took a close look and decided that it needed further examination at the Royal Sussex Hospital and completed a form in the endeavour to get me seen ASAP. He said that if I hadn't heard back within two weeks to contact him. 
Whilst with the doctor I raised another issue, 'the arthritis in my neck'. To cut a long story short he prescribed me Co-Codamol 8/500
tablets which would help me manage the pain when it is at its worst.
I felt relieved about the ear problem and pleased to have the additional pain killers for my arthritis. The doctor was very easy to talk to and I felt confident going forward.

title: X-ray department
body: It would help if a simple map of your departments was available.  Trying to find where the CT scan department is not very helpful even with the written word.

title: Opening weekends
body:
Great idea for patients and GP
Less congestion easier for patients to park
Takes pressure off access to appts weekdays.

title: A Great NHS practice.
body: I find Doctors,Nurses, and everyone at this surgery extremely friendly and most helpful they certainly go the extra mile , the reception staff always where possibly try to get you an appointment and they do no perform miracles if no appointments are available they can't give out one , getting through on the phone can be slow but remember there are many other people in the same position so you have to be patient , The nurses do the clinics and taking blood are so understanding and kind it's a pleasure to attend Langworthy Medical practice it's got to be one one best practices, so be thankful that you are with a great practice.

title: Could be better
body: They need to get Doctors in the surgery I got to see the practice nurse today and she was very good with me today

title: Good practice
body: Seen by practice nurse who diagnosed a long standing problem and the treatment prescribed worked perfectly.

title: Poor
body:
I felt the ward was ran with no privacy or dignity to the patients. I understand that its a very busy place but to discuss private and personal information with all A and E is very difficult to accept at least be offered to speak privately in a room .which were clearly not being used at the time. My sister was taken to A and E as this was her second relapes on alcohol and was unable to work properly due to withdrawal and need a wheelchair to get down to A&E. She was forced to walk up and down the middle of a busy A&E department with very strong alcohol withdrawal symptoms ( very bad shakes struggling to walk sweating  ) so we're is patient's dignity, privacy and care, is this the protocol you all too  adhere ? 
This happened last night in A & E adults we were in A&E around about 13.30 pm till 11.30 pm.

title: Fabulous minor injuries service
body: A big thank you to all the minor injuries team who have been helping me for the past six weeks.  You go above and beyond with a smile and laugh despite the busy shifts. You are a true asset to the community and nursing as a whole. Thank you so much xxxxx

author: horologiumny57
title: Great medical care and treatment
body:
My daughter received medical care through calling 111. Then was seen by Dr. Gilmore before 11:00pm. She received excellent medical care, assessment and treatment from Dr. Gilmore during this visit.  
In addition my daughter and I were in York U.K. on vacation and had traveled from South Carolina (U.S.A.). We we're in the middle of our tour of your community and were very stressed due to being foreigners and in a medical emergency.  
Dr. Gilmore was very professional in his care of my daughter. I would like to add that we were able to finish our vacation together and returned home safely, mainly due to Dr. Gilmore's support that evening. I would like to recommend Dr. Gilmore for the Star award through your hospital. He deserves this nomination and a raise. He is an excellent example of worthy physician.  
I would like to send him a holiday card if possible.  
Thanks to him and to you all for super care

title: very bad
body:
my husband got a tooth infection on friday, in the evening I ran 111 for advice, they gave us a number to phone next day in saturday, after ringing that number several times with no success in answering the phon, we rang again 111 they told us the same, my husband was getting worse and worse with a swollen face going to his eye, they gave us another two numbers to ring but they didn't picked up the phone and the answering machine was saying that was too busy to answer the phone. rang 111 again each time for them to answer took around 30 minutes, their only answer was take ibuprofen which clearly he got a huge big painful infection.
I can't understand if we pay nhs taxes how this can happen they should provide a good care for us,it's extremely worried the poor service that all uk citizens are receiving.

title: Impressed
body: Just visited A&E with a broken finger. Really impressed with how quickly I was dealt with with - less than an hour from start to finish.  Even better, though, are the staff who are very efficient and friendly and courteous at the same time.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Huge improvement over the past couple of years
body: My mother had to visit A&E and was taken care of extremely well. The ambulance staff were excellent as always - caring, helpful and very professional. Time to be seen by the doctor on arrival was 1 hour and the attending doctor was also excellent. She undertook a thorough assessment and from then on kept us appraised of the sequence of events every 20 minutes so that we were not left in the dark. Her bedside manner, and that of the nurses was just so reassuring and empathetic that my mother felt at ease the whole time. The person who registered my wife and I in the waiting room was similarly professional - there was a lady ahead of us who only spoke Italian and he made a point of seeking out a doctor who could converse in the language. The total time in hospital was around 4-5 hours and although most of that time was spent in the hallway, the experience was a positive one and an immense improvement on our previous visit 2 years ago. Congratulations to the hospital and my sincere thanks to all the staff who go over and above to keep us safe.

title: Great practice
body: My daughter received the most amazing  service from the Ambulance Service who arrived within 15 minutes of our call to all of the A &E staff as well as Haematology and the x-ray department who cared and looked after our precious daughter. Thank you all so very much.

title: Great Cross Service
Caring nurses and doctors
body: Had my Covid and flu jab today the organisation was seamless as usual the staff were happy smiling and very helpful the nurse that gave me my jabs was so kind and I didn’t even realise she had given them I would say this doctors surgery is the best in Suffolk Thankyou for caring for us patients I really appreciate you all

title: Friendly Staff and Efficient Service
body:
Cut my finger on a tin at home, was sent to Haywood Walk-in by the pharmacist. Was seen and stitched up within an hour and a half and on my way home soon after.

Was very happy with the service and would use for similar injuries again. Thank you.

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: Great care from a busy team
body: Thank you so much to everyone in A&E last week who helped me when I was suffering from acute pain caused by kidney stones. I know how overstretched you all are but you still managed to give excellent care and very good management decisions throughout. The nurses and doctors were all so helpful and despite the pressure you are clearly under, you have a smile on your faces and carry out your jobs with such care. Thank you so much to everyone

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sookay
title: Accessing GP
body:
My husband was having an issue with neck/shoulder pain which he thought physio might be able to help. He contacted his GP and let them know what the issue was. He very quickly got a text back saying that it was a physio problem and that the physio service would contact him later.  
In less than an hour James, the physio, rang. My husband a good in-depth consultation with James. A plan of action was discussed and sets of exercises were emailed through. If he was still having problems in a week or two, he's to arrange to see James face-to-face.

title: Excellent practice
body: I am very pleased with the service this GP provides. The staff is very helpful and I received an answer to my requests quite quick. I very much appreciate their service.

title: Amazing Care
body:
I just had to leave a review after my experience today. No stone left unturned. Went the extra mile and got home feeling so much better

Thank you

title: Emergency care, empathy and superb attention
body: My wife took ill at home, and I took her straight to the surgery. After a few minutes we were greeted by a practice Doctor. She immediately put a plan into place after initial review and following an ECG etc she was transferred to hospital. In 5 years I have listened to criticism of the practice mostly answering the phone, so please allow me to say the experience (2nd time with our family recently) was first class all round from the Doctor, Nurse and reception staff. You could not ask for more and sadly I am not allowed to mention names but will drop a nice card off with some biscuits when having their deserved cup of tea!! We are extremely grateful.

title: Exceptional Care
body:
I attended for surgery on the 1st Nov initially, a lovely female junior doctor assessed my lump and said it would be best removed under GA. (This was an unnecessary surgery due to GP's did not see me soon enough, through 'it's phone appointments diagnosis')

I came back on the 2nd Nov on the surgical assessment unit. I was put at ease, everyone was friendly, things explained well.
Even though I hate general anesthetic the surgical team put me at ease.
Surgery couldn't have gone better, I remained on the SAU after, had a lovely meal also (Bonus)
To all on the Surgical Assessment Unit, Exceptional Care, Be Proud :)
Thank You

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care and treatment
body:
The staff were all extremely professional and I felt at all times they were looking after me very well. 
The room I was in was very clean, warm and well equipped.
The operation itself was a success and pain was minimal (less than I expected).

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: cardiac department
body: I was day patient and found Doctors and nurses to very helpful and put me at ease during my stay and had everything explained to me at all times.

title: Best practice I’ve ever used
body:
I registered here a year ago after moving to the area as it was my most local surgery. I’m young and well so I haven’t needed anything until this month, where a lump on my arm quickly became very painful.

I phoned on a Thursday evening and managed to get an appointment with a GP for the coming Monday, which I thought was brilliant. The GP I saw was professional and thorough, but also kind.

After a course of antibiotics I went back to the practice where this time I met one of the nurses. They were fab, exceptionally personable and caring. I have since had to see the same nurse quite a few times for follow-ups and it’s lovely that we now just have a nice chat and catch-up while the appointment takes place.

In addition to this, the reception staff have always been friendly and helpful with me, be it over the phone or in person.

Aside from the great staff, I am most impressed with how easily I can get an appointment when needed. They will always try their best to get me seen if it needs to be that day, or book me in soon after if they can’t. They also make every effort to work around my shift patterns which I hugely appreciate. My only critique is that on some occasions I have had to wait a very long time on the phone in the morning to get through to reception, but I appreciate this is very common for many practices and the morning is obviously their busiest time on the phones.

Overall I’m absolutely chuffed with Riverlyn and whilst I hope to not need their services much again in the future, I feel in safe hands if I do.

title: well done SpaMedica
body:
I was dreading it but after months of putting up with loss of vision I saw my optician and within a short time I was seen and yesterday I had laser treatment.
The staff were lovely and I felt like I was being cared for by caring and compassionate staff. The were warm and professional and put me at my ease, with even a cup of coffee and a biscuit. I cannot recommend the team highly enough. Thank you. I am very greatfull

title: Great Service
body: The nurse on duty was excellent (17/11/22). She was extremely professional, and provided high quality care.

title: Friendly and efficient service
body: I have to visit the Urology outpatients dept every ten/twelve weeks . I have always found them friendly and efficient, always putting me at ease and willing to answer any questions thrown at them satisfactorily. I cannot fault them in any way from the moment I enter reception to the excellent service received from the nurses.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Experience
body:
After completing the 111 online form about my daughter, I quickly received a call from the Nurse Practitioner at Shotley. They were friendly and helpful. An appointment was arranged within the hour.
Once at urgent care, the same nurse dealt with my daughter. They spoke to her and explained everything. Their manner was fantastic and it meant my daughter got the help she needed quickly and efficiently.
The whole team at urgent care were friendly and helpful- even late at night!
Thank you!

title: Flue/Covid vaccination
body: Everything was very well organised and efficient. The staff did a great job. Great service and thanks!

title: Excellent practice
body: Friendly professional staff giving an excellent service in pleasant surroundings. All in all, a pleasing experience.

title: Supportive and helpful
body: I cannot fault the service from this practice. My Mum has Alzheimer’s and they understand that I am her main carer and also work full time. They try their very best to find appointments to meet the needs of my mum and to enable me to bring Mum to the service. The reception staff are fabulous and go out of their way to help where they can. The care my Mum receives is outstanding and I thank you all.

title: Where do I start….
body:
Our little boy was recently admitted to lister hospital after falling very poorly. From start to finish we received such good care and treatment from all members of staff we encountered. the children’s a+e was packed and struggling with the volume of patients while we was there, I feel sorry for the staff as they were over run and in the firing line of impatient stressed parents even though it’s clear they were doing the best they could.
Everyone made sure both my partner and I were ok during the whole process and well catered for. As for the health care I can honestly say I don’t think we could ask for a better service then we experienced, the whole medical team involved left no stones unturned to find out what was wrong with our son and how to move forward with his care. Everyone came across very genuine and concerned for our boy and that was of great comfort to us. We can’t thank everyone working with or in the bluebell ward  for everything. Every member is a true credit to the Nhs and should be valued in the highest regard. 
The only thing I would say is the room needs a bit of an update. It’s not really child friendly or in great condition, especially if the stay is prolonged for any amount of time. This does not reflect on any of the staff in any shape or form. 
Once again we thank all involved in the caring of our son and supporting him back to health

title: Very helpful in an emergency
body: I phoned the practice after my partner passed out and worried me that he wasn't recovering very quickly.  On phoning, the receptionist was very helpful in getting a doctor to phone me back for details and then phoning for ambulance.  Very informative and helpful altogether and without it my partner might not have been here.  Many many thanks.

title: Poor service
body:
Called the doctors as I have hurt my back.. was advised by receptionist to call back next morning at 8am to book an appointment. And that a physiotherapist would call me at 1030 today..  he called just after 11am which is ok and said he would email some exercises to do ..  i received nothing and I’d told him my email address twice to confirm it was correct.. 
Next morning when I called in and booked the doctors appointment I mentioned I hadn’t received the email containing the exercise information.. so I checked they had the correct email address and the  receptionist said she’d pass on the message to get the email sent across ..  I still received nothing .. had my doctors appointment later that day and i mentioned to the doctor that I still hadn’t received the email .. she didn’t say anything and I said I hope I receive it today..  
so in future I’m not going to waste my time talking to the physiotherapist they use. 
5 days on still nothing !

title: Compassionate care.
body: My mum is a nurse at PAH, she is always telling me how important compassionate care is, and today I witnessed this. The nurse took her time to see me and comfort me, even though she was very busy. It really meant alot. Thank you.

title: Sympathetic help.
body: The physios were friendly but very professional, carefully explaining the reasons for the various exercise routines, and changing them as the problem was resolved.

title: Very efficient
body: I came I  yesterday with a deep gash to the face. Process was quick, polite and efficient. Thank you.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great experience
body:
I attended the MRI unit (I’m sorry I don’t know the name) on 19/11/22, I was very nervous and anxious and did not think I would be able to go through with the scan. The two doctors there (sorry I don’t know their names) were so lovely and made me feel totally at ease. They went out of their way to make sure I felt completely ok before they left the room, despite being busy! 
Thank you :-)

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: All the Doctors are very caring and understanding. They send you for blood tests and scans if they think it is necessary and find them very thorough . Also I find the receptionists very helpful.

title: Efficient vaccine programme
body: Turned up for Covid and flu boosters at appointed time, went straight in with only tiny queue. Disappointed that no staff let alone patients were wearing masks - the vulnerable must feel forgotten.

title: Great service
body: I took my mum for a procedure.Right from the very helpful and pleasant man who welcomed us to the reception staff the service we received was first class .I would highly recommend this  service to everyone so thank you .

title: Amazing service
body: The treatment I received was second to non. My councillor went over and above many times, for which I will be forever eternally grateful. The support I received has meant that I can make the most of my life now which before treatment was something I never thought possible.

title: Brilliant staff
body: After another trip to A&E paediatrics. The staff was fantastic at treating my son during a asthma attack. Very kind to myself and can’t thank them enough once again for looking after my son. My daughter also suffers with asthma and the always give us so much care despite how busy it can be. They are brilliant

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely clinic
body: To say I was very frightened about having my cataract operation is an understatement but everyone at Spa medica did everything to put me at ease. The whole procedure was totally painless and I will not have the same fear when I go for my 2nd one. Thank you to everyone there.

title: Great practice - flexible, accommodating,…
body: I submitted an e-consult requesting an appointment to address multiple problems I was worried about and offering only a specific date in which I could be seen due to work commitments. I was offered an appointment 2 days later on the date and within the timeframe I'd requested and saw a professional and excellent doctor who listened to and addressed all my concerns within a 10 minute consultation, and I left feeling reassured and in safe hands. Thank you so much for a great service and great care.

title: Exceeded all expectations - Sittingbourne
body:
I needed cataract operations on both eyes on NHS. Referred directly to SpaMedica in Sittingbourne by Specsavers at my request, and operations were carried out in August and October 2022 with post op reviews by Specsavers after each operation.

Compared to the experience of people I know with other local providers, the waiting time from initial referral to hearing directly from SpaMedica was very quick and straightforward.

Every single member of staff was highly professional and kind to me and to my wife who accompanied me, from pre-op tests to the operations themselves to making sure I was OK and issuing post-op eye drops.

The clinic is new and excellently equipped, and entirely dedicated to cataract surgery, with absolutely no pressure to consider anything other than NHS funded treatment.

Each step of the operation was carefully and fully explained to me, and so I knew exactly what was happening at each stage. The procedure itself was quick and trouble-free. 

I would definitely recommend SpaMedica at Sittingbourne to anyone as the first and best choice for cataract surgery.

title: Lost my blood test results
body: Been waiting over a month for my blood test results so i rang me surgery and they informed me that they have been lost. My doctor said do you just want to wait for them to turn up. Absolute joke i am in cronic pain.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Awful communication
body: Registered new married name and for online services a month ago. Phoned up and nothing changed! Then told they’re changing their systems in November so won’t make changes how else it’ll all need reloading after anyway! Great communication. Also, I got some anxiety meds prescribed about two years ago, didn’t take them and so didn’t refill the prescription. However no one has called to check on me or tell me stopping medicine suddenly could be dangerous. Awful patient care. Same with my diagnosis of underactive thyroid. Told to make appointment for blood tests every 3 months “you’ll need to make the appointment as no one will chase you for it.” Great, thanks!!

title: Not very Loud!
body: I have just rung Chatterton House, Kings Lynn and could hardly hear the message.   Please can you get the talker to talk more loudly??!!

title: Speedy and professional service
body:
My husband phoned an ambulance on Friday evening as he was unable to get a doctor to visit quickly. I was very unwell and had severe breathing difficulties. He dialled 999 and was speaking to an operator in Birmingham who told him a London ambulance was on the way. Within 10 minutes the ambulance were here. They were very professional and reassuring. They performed numerous tests, spoke to my GP and it was clear I was suffering from a chest infection for the past two weeks, and not a flu thst I believed I had. They obtained a prescription, via my GP, for antibiotics to be sent to my local chemist. They even offered to collect the meds for me if my chemist couldn't deliver. They ascertained we were aware of what we needed to do and be aware of and told my husband if my condition worsened to contact them straight away. Due to their speed and professionalism, three days later I am well on the road to recovery. We would never normally phone the emergency services for a minor problem but i am grateful that my husband did.
We did not expect or presume such a speedy response, especially when we know they are so poorly staffed but their response time and care was second to none and I truly feel I would not have survived the night, but for them. We wholeheartedly thank them for their dedication and service during this difficult time.

title: Dereliction of duties
body:
I phoned the practice at 08.30 for the on call GP to phone me regarding my mother. I stated to call on my mobile. The landline was phoned when i was out. I re phoned at 16.00 to reiterate i required to talk to the GP. No GP phoned me.
Mum required antibiotics and steroids for a chest infection. I have the same and live with her.
The next morning mum's condition worsened and 111 was phoned resulting in mum going to hospital to lay on a trolley for 10 hours to be discharged with , guess what, antibiotics and steroids.
How much does an ambulance, hospital admission for 10 hours cost? Not to mention mum's,93, unpleasant and uncomfortable experience physically and mentally.
All could have been avoided with a GP phone call .

author: nuthatchxf66
title: I’ve had the best care
body: The staff are amazing, friendly and comforting,I’ve had numerous appointments for injections and blood tests, after a bad experience in my life can honestly say I’ve had the best care

author: rhyss
title: Amazing care
body:
I’d gone in with a rather personal issue and I was eventually put with a Dr Bradley, he was ever so kind and delicate and made me feel super comfortable. He made sure to come back and find me ASAP between our visits and gave me a well-informed chat about everything he was doing and why, he carried no judgement and made that very clear and kept me up to date as much as he could.  
He took great care with me when administering a jab and took great care with me afterwards. He made the 10 hours I was there very comfortable so hopefully he sees this and knows how grateful i am for all his kindness yesterday.

author: cafexe85
title: Refused appointment when GP instructs to make one
body:
Another example of really poor systems and communication. Blood tests abnormal. Severe chronic condition that requires close monitoring. GP texts says make appointment asap. Reception refuses to do so. Repeatedly told I have to be put in triage queue when already been triaged by the GP who texted.  
I do not feel it is OK for reception to override. They are not clinicians. There have been no appointments for over 2 weeks. Unsurprising when patients are unnecessarily being put back into the triage system.  
Management and GPs need to talk to each other.

author: blackbirdgm78
title: No call back from GP
body:
Have had a fever for 5 days. I called the GP surgery at 8:00 asking for a GP appointment. I was told the GP will call in the morning but I needed to fill out the econsult form online after the phone call ended.  
I attempted to complete the form but when it asked about having a fever, or body pain, or chest pain, you can’t answer yes or no, it tells you to seek medical help somewhere else? I had already called to ask for a GP appointment so this is confusing. At 18:22 there is still no call from the GP. I still have a fever and am very unwell and scared. Feels like a very unsafe situation.

author: Arthur255
title: They wrote to the wrong GP
body: The Hub quotes an inaccurate postal address (Middlesex abolished decades ago). The Hub email was blank. Finally, they wrote to wrong GP at my practice and using the wrong postcode.

author: equuleusfg57
title: Getting an appointment is impossible
body:
I have been trying to get an non-urgent appointment at the Maltings on and off for the last 3 months. I have tried calling at 8:00am on numerous occasions and get a recorded message saying the list is full for that day. I have spoken to receptionists on the phone, given a link to book which takes me to PatientAccess. There are no options for booking an appointment for my problem, in fact there are only 3 options Smear, Physio, and Flu Vaccination.  
I have gone in and asked how I get an appointment, and have been sent the same link. It is impossible to get an future dated face to face appointment. I have managed to get a phone appointment where the doctor has called me at a really inconvenient time.  
I have been a patient at the Maltings for 20 years and am completely at a loss as to what has happened. It seems they do not want any patients coming in for face to face appointments. The communication from the practice is non-existent and the website completely out of date as far as information about booking appointments.

author: zulufe83
title: So many more people could be treated.
body:
My experience so far shows me how woefully inefficient our healthcare system is. So many more people could be treated  
I arrived yesterday 24 hours ago with numbness in left hand and face. After 8 hours I’d had ECG and CT scan which showed no stroke or immediate danger and my condition had changed which suggests possible neurological issue. I was well to go home but consultant may want to refer me for an MRI. Asked to stay overnight and see consultant next morning  
There were no checks on me through the night (total waste of time and NHS resource in my opinion). I was seen by the doctor in the early hours of the morning, who told me what I already knew i.e. I’m ok to go home but MRI would be ideal follow up. Need to wait for consultant. Saw consultant at before lunchtime who will see if I can have MRI today or if I have to come back. 2 hours later I still don’t know.  
I’m self employed. I can’t earn therefore can’t pay taxes which funds the NHS. Why oh why can’t they just access the MRI booking system and book me in or send me home so someone else can have this bed? Shocking waste of public resources.  
Total lack of communication. I have to go to the nurses station myself to ask for updates and get an idea of how long I need to wait to find out if I’ll have an MRI today or not. This is terrible  
Update: I actually ended up discharging myself as hours and hours later the staff were still unable to tell me if I would be able to have an MRI or not as the MRI department was so busy. I took that as a no then.  
I’ve ended up getting an urgent referral to a stroke specialist later this week and having a telephone consultation following which I’m hoping I will finally get an MRI.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Bccphobic
title: Cardiology - best treatment and care
body:
Over the last few months I have had to attend Forth Valley Royal Hospital for heart related treatment.  
On each and every occasion I have invariably found the staff to be extremely efficient and focussed on giving me the best treatment and care possible.  
In particular Doctors Padfield (Decisions and referral), and Venkat (Pacemaker fitting), Electrocardiology nurses - Ricardo, Julie, Hayley and Tracey and post-surgery care nurses - Catriona and Caitlin have all been extremely personable and reassuring.  
In particular over the last 2 or 3 days my help from Julie, Hayley and Tracy has been above and beyond anything that should be expected. I am immensely grateful to all of them.  
I am sorry, there are several other nurses and students whose names I have unfortunately forgotten and I should emphasise that all the staff I have dealt with from receptionists to consultants have been excellent.

title: Rubbish!
body: I am so fed up with this practice leaving me a message to ring them back - what a joke! I've given up after 30 minutes, first of all I'm number three, then it starts ringing and ringing and never stops!  The attitude is insulting, if you fill anything in on the website you then get a lecture as to why you shouldn't do it...I've got more chance of getting in touch with Florence Nightingale via a Medium than getting a response from this Practice!

author: Eilymcn
title: Direct Assessment Unit (DAU) experience
body:
I was referred via my GP to DAU and I had a wonderful experience. The GP had queried a clot in my left leg and wanted to get me seen to rule it out.  
I arrived at DAU at 12 mid day and was seen immediately by a lovely nurse Laura. She had my blood pressure checked and bloods sent off immediately I couldn't of got a better nurse.  
I was then seen by Dr Damian who was so reassuring and give me peace of mind that they had ruled out a clot and that I could contact them again if the pain doesn't settle in a couple of weeks. DAU is a fantastic unit and a fantastic service.  
Thanks so much for all your help

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: golfxr36
title: Having an MRI
body:
I just want to say a huge thank you to the MRI department at Gartnavel General Hospital.  
I was extremely anxious and they reassured me and supported me all the way through the procedure. They were caring and professional throughout. As someone who works for the NHS it was different being the patient and I was extremely grateful for the kindness I was showed.  
Special thanks to Graham

author: Penfriend61
title: Annual Diabetes Foot Review
body:
I attended the Diabetes Podiatry Screening Clinic at the Arches Wellbeing Centre in Belfast.  
This was a re-arranged appointment as I was unwell for the original appointment. When I telephoned to re-arrange my appointment, the Podiatry Assistant was understanding, empathetic and helpful in giving me a new date.  
On this occasion my review was undertaken by Glenda. Glenda introduced herself, told me her name and was very welcoming, friendly and immediately made me feel at ease. As I have mobility and other issues Glenda made sure I was safe in getting to the consultation room and into the seat. She offered help with removing my footwear and tying my shoelaces. She was very respectful and kind.  
Glenda explained each step of the assessment to me, listened to my questions and answered them confidently. At no time did I feel rushed and I felt Glenda was very knowledgeable in her field.  
At the end of the assessment Glenda reassured me that the Diabetes Team were available and not to hesitate in contacting them should I have any concerns.  
Overall this was a very good patient experience and I would be very happy if I was reviewed by Glenda in the future. Thank you Glenda.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: EastR53
title: Day Case Operation
body:
I attended the New Victoria ACH for a daycase surgical procedure. The members of staff looking after me were all friendly, professional and accommodating. The unit was clean, calm and well organised.  
Newly qualified nurse Sarah completed my pre-operative paperwork and helped keep me calm before my procedure. The surgeon, Mr Smith, spent time to explain the procedure and listen to my concerns. Post-operatively SN Gail was fantastic. She cared for me with the utmost professionalism and I’m really thankful for the time she gave to me.

author: craterqy64
title: Breast cancer care gartnavel general Glasgow
body:
I attended a meeting today as a support for my dear friend who has breast cancer. It was the first meeting with Mr Wilson and specialist nurse Louise.  
The way Mr Wilson communicated was incredible! He was calm, very detailed in his explanation and covered everything we had prepared as questions to ask. He was very compassionate, kind and respectful. He treated my friend as the strong intelligent woman she is.  
She then spoke to the nurse specialist Louise. The same careful sensitive manner and very efficient scheduling. We both came away feeling relieved and in very safe hands.  
Thanks so much for an incredible service.  
Massively reduces the stress of the situation.

author: Happi Patient
title: The service given from Whitwell Surgery
body:
Over the past few years I've felt the standard was slipping at Whitwell Surgery. The Pandemic was very difficult for everyone concerned, staff as well as patients. However, over the past year both my husband and I feel that everything has picked up.  
We are feeling that the surgery is getting back to the good old days of face-to-face appointments, we both feel we're being looked after. Both nurses are really caring and helpful, it's great to see Sarah back! Both receptionists are friendly and helpful, especially Fran, who we seem to deal with the most.  
Dr Hussain has been nothing but extremely helpful, caring & patient when explaining isssues which concen our health. Onwards and upwards, Whitwell Surgery. Thanks so much, especially to Fran, Sarah and Dr Hussain.

author: Lucye123
title: Consistently fantastic care for my entire family
body:
Barton House provides an amazing level of care for my entire family.  I have been at the practice for about seven years and they have been wonderful at helping me (throughout two pregnancies), my two young children and my partner.  

The reception staff are friendly,  understanding and informative and always make sure the kids are seen when they’re unwell.  

The doctors are amazing at fitting us in, despite their long days and always call back to check how the kids are doing.  They seem to have good instincts knowing when to prescribe antibiotics and when to wait and see.  When we do wait and see how infections play out instead of taking antibiotics, I never feel left on my own because they check in to see how the kids are doing and monitor the situation.  They are kind, respectful and thorough.  

The nurses are wonderful too - kind, efficient and very good at their jobs.  

Everyone in this surgery works so hard and deserves recognition for this.  I could not recommend Barton House highly enough!

title: Brilliant Doctor
body: I felt they really took the time to listen to my symptoms and were very thorough with their assessment and the follow up tests they have arranged for me.

title: Amazing practice
body: Amazing and friendly staff. It’s very easy to get an appointment. Special mention to the nurse as she has been extremely caring and so helpful.

title: Great Care Home.
body: My Aunt is very well looked after. The staff are attentive,Caring, and very friendly. The home is bright and very clean. Doesn’t smell like a care home. My aunt is very happy there.

title: Excellent
body: As usual a fantastic experience when receiving COVID booster and flu vaccine. All the staff are delightful and friendly. Both booking a slot and getting the shots is well organised. Couldn't ask for a better GP practice.

author: marsdr58
title: Excellent service
body:
My partner was in so much pain (after suffering in silence for 3 weeks ) he could cope no more and went to Bodmin Minor Injuries- he was seen within 1 hour, and referred immediately to Camborne & Redruth Hospital - on arrival they were waiting for him- he was seen within the hour , had many tests which at the time showed up as negative, he was advised if the pain continues to seek advice from his GP.  
He could take the pain no more, and following a telephone triage he was asked to go and meet with his GP, who immediately diagnosed a blood clot in the calf and put him on medication, plus pain relief.  
A referral to the DVT clinic was made and an appointment arrived within 5 days.  
He has been seen in RCHT, had more tests and a further blood test and formally diagnosed with a blood clot- he has received his medication , and now on his merry way!  
He has had amazing service from start to finish - staff have been helpful, respectful, and supportive.  
Customer service at all of the hospitals attended has been amazing - take comfort from the positive, you can't make everyone happy all of the time!

title: Brilliantly welcoming and well run GP Practice
body: Very well run, efficient and friendly trip to the Leiston Surgery for Covid and Flu vaccinations today. Really appreciate everyone who gave up their weekend to offer this service.

title: Very good experience
body: I had a collection of pus on an infected thumb. The advanced nurse practitioner was kind empathetic and efficient. She gave me time to recover as the procedure was quite painful! I felt so reassured as it is so difficult to seey GP. Thankyou

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exemplary Surgery
body: I have been registered with the surgery for a very long period of time. Happy with the service provided. Always there and ready to help under any circumstances

title: Amazing practice
body:
Recently joined this practice after relocating to Stafford, was a little apprehensive and didn’t know what to expect - was pleasantly surprised! 
Found the receptionists and GP to be kind, caring, professional and helpful. Thanks Beaconside Health Centre for reassuring my confidence in the nhs

author: omegabe43
title: I couldn't have asked for better care.
body:
Since leaving the hospital, I have had home visits from START.  
It was Simone who came to see me and I couldn't have asked for better care. She took time to listen to my concerns, answer my many questions, find out the answers for me to any she couldn't answer herself, reassure me when I was upset, showed interest in the "real me" and not just the "stroke me" and of course gave me the tools, exercises and encouragement to help me in my recovery.  
Simone is so dedicated to her job and I can't thank her enough for the kindness and caring she has given me.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Lovely staff
body: I had a major op here last week my first ever op and they were really good looking after me.  My only concern was communication my husband rang to ask if I was okay and back from theatre but couldn’t get through.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant service
body: Called 111 and was referred for an appointment to be seen within the hour. Checked in by reception, x-rayed and reviewed quickly but full checks done. Friendly staff on reception, porters and nurse practitioners.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly & Efficient
body: I attended the Brownley Green health centre for a minor op.  I was seen quickly, and the two ladies that saw me were friendly and super efficient.  I was in and out in no time, and they put me at ease.  Great service, thank you.

title: Reception Staff - fantastic
body: I visited severnvale surgery for the first time today and I was impressed with the reception staff, so friendly and kind. Really impressed by their work ethic and how they were handling patients. The lady with the blonde hair was exceptionally good whilst dealing with dr sickness and managing the queues

title: Good practice
body:
A thorough and reassuring examination given by the doctor. 
The receptionists were very helpful and even rung at home to  make sure I had the right date for the next appointment.
Totally pleasant experience for a first visit after Covid. 
Thank you

title: Kind and caring staff
body: A few days ago my husband brought me in to A&E after a bad fall at home. I was in intense pain in my leg which made worse by any movement. I was checked in quickly and soon afterwards a nurse took my details and I was sent for an x ray. I was then put into a side room where a nursing assistant made sure I was as comfortable as possible. I had to wait for a while for the doctor to see me but in that time members of staff checked on me and we were offered hot drinks. The doctor said I had not broken any bones and could go home with some painkillers. The nursing assistant insisted that I try to walk a few steps before leaving, she did this firmly and kindly. Despite the department being very busy, everyone was kind and caring, introducing themselves by name.

title: Very positive
body: I rarely post reviews but I had my first visit to Long Hanborough Medical Centre today and my first experience of Eynsham Group Practice was very positive. The staff were all friendly and helpful; and the Doctor I saw gave me plenty of time, was thorough and sought my involvement in choosing the way I’d like to proceed with medical investigations. Thank you

title: Great practice
body: Came in for blood pressure readings - very pleasant nurse, checked everything. Got flu jab at the same time

title: Waste of taxpayers money
body: This service should be shut down and save the nhs some money. Literally not fit for purpose. Called this morning about daughters eye infection which she has suffered with on and off since birth. She is 9 months old. Got an appointment for 3pm fantastic!!! Only to be given the wrong location no where near where the appointment was booked. So rang again whilst in the car park of the wrong location. Very helpful lady said it would be red flagged and an urgent call for antibiotics off a doctor. 3 hours later I get a call from a uncompassionate nurse. Going through the same information I had already been through twice. I was told a doctor would call me back. I questioned the lady as I thought that's what I had been expecting for her to tell me I must have misunderstood in a very condescending way. That lady should definitely not be a nurse. So she said an urgent call would come from the doctor with in 1 hour. 2 hours later still nothing. So altogether 8.5 hours waiting and still no antibiotics. This service must be a huge drain on nhs resources filled with very incompetent staff. Should have just gone to A and E would have been sorted now. And this service is suppose to elevate the strain on the A and E department what a shambles.

author: Haldaral73
title: Agonising wait for PMSA Pet scan
body:
I would like to highlight a distressing and entirely unexpected situation that myself and my family find ourselves in.  
In early September my loving, precious husband and dad of our three amazing kids was watching breakfast tv and there was a segment advising all men over 50 to approach their GP to request a PSA- a simple blood test which is an indicator for issues (both benign and malignant) with the prostate gland. My husband, being proactive did exactly that. Our GP called to advise that she was sorry to tell him his PSA was 43, substantially elevated. She advised she would refer for further investigation and to urology for urgent review.  
An appointment came through later that week for a bone scan (mid October) and an appointment with the urology consultant the following day at a waiting list clinic. At this point, we were both feeling relieved that NHS Lanarkshire was all over this and thankfully my husband had been pro-active.  
The radiographer at University Hospital Monklands (UHM) on the day of the bone scan was superb. Upon hearing the appointment with the urology consultant was the following day, he went above and beyond to speak with the radiologist to have the scan reported and available for the following day.  
We then both attended University Hospital Hairmyres (UHH) the following day to see the urology consultant. His approach was very honest and he advised the prostate felt ‘abnormal’ and he would refer for MRI and TRUS (transrectal ultrasound scan) biopsy and get a further PSA.  
MRI was confirmed for a few days later with TRUS biopsy arranged for the following Monday. You can see looking at this timeline why my pride in NHS Lanarkshire is not misplaced!  
When we attended for TRUS biopsy, we were both floored to be advised by the Urology Nurse Specialist and Consultant that despite our beliefs that this diagnosis was caught early, there was advanced local spread with seminal vesicles as well as lymph node involvement and that the majority of the prostate appeared abnormal on MRI. Bone scan appeared negative for bone metastases. They were both fantastic in their approach and very supportive. The consultant that day advised he already had my husbands name on the Multi Disciplinary Team (MDT) discussion list for 1st November before performing the TRUS biopsy. We had an appointment confirmed with the Lead Urology Cancer Nurse Specialist the following day to discuss the outcome of MDT:  
All biopsy samples were positive for prostate cancer  
Gleason score was 4+5=9  
70% of the total tissue sent to labs was involved  
Current PSA was 50.1  
All of this places my husband in a high risk group  
The MDT had discussed our case at length, taken into consideration his age, lack of any co-morbidities, general fitness and decided they would take an equally aggressive multi-modality approach to treatment. Consultant would request a PSMA PET scan and if this was clear for bone metastases, the surgical team in Glasgow would consider a robotic radical prostatectomy. My husband was also referred to the Consultant Oncologist for consideration of best adjuvant approach with/without surgery. Again, the person centred and assertiveness of the MDT in throwing everything in their arsenal at this is to be totally commended.  
This has all been as diligent, proactive and (controlled) chaotic a time since GP appointment to now, as it reads.  
However, now we are left…….waiting……agonisingly waiting…….  
The referral was made on 2nd November. We were advised the scanner only operates on Wednesdays but would not be operational on 9th initially. Advised on 11th that scanner will not be operational on 16th either due to lack of adequate patients on list. There is no commitment as to when the scanner will operate.  
Surely it is within the gift of NHS Scotland and the Scottish Clinical Imaging Network to take a cohesive and collaborative approach and have one scanner running between the four sites in Scotland regularly enough that patients do not have this agonising and potentially catastrophic wait.  
I note in the recent Scottish Clinical Imaging Network (SCIN) waiting list report the addendum that PSMA (Prostate Specific Membrane Antigen )scans are not included as they are booked in advance to differing waiting time standards. Is the standard fit for purpose and justifiable?  
I find this to be an abomination as every patient on that list is precious and this goes against every value and the entire ethos of our NHS as an institution. I am sure there will be others in my husband’s position of this scan being crucial to planned recovery and positive outcomes or the unimaginable alternative.  
The Royal Marsden in London and Sutton offer this scan privately at great cost. Despite additional efforts this week of the consultant and nurse specialists involved to have this expedited, we all had to admit defeat on Friday and my husband’s current clinical record has been sent to The Royal Marsden.  
We would absolutely travel to an alternative NHS site in Scotland to have this scan if it was an option. If payment was required to do this, we would be more than willing to put this back into our NHS in Scotland.  
I am concerned as we enter winter pressures, with strikes on the horizon and the ongoing effects of covid that pressures within our NHS will substantially risk further delay if we can’t get this treatment off the starter blocks as soon as possible. All other options are not on the table in the hope that surgery is. In the meantime, these cancer cells are left to proliferate unhindered by any active treatment.  
My concern is obviously first and foremost to achieve the best possible outcome for my cherished, young and otherwise healthy husband but he will not be the first or the last of our NHS patients and their loved ones to face this anguish and distress.  
I therefore implore you to do anything you possibly can to support us in progressing with this equally critical and pivotal investigation. We are left here meantime waiting, petrified and facing an uncertain future.

author: CMacUnicorn
title: Maternity Labour Suite, theatre, recovery. Heroes.
body:
I had a planned c section last week with a premature baby that I knew would be going to intensive care when born due to many complications. I was very upset and anxious about it all but the staff at the labour suite were absolutely amazing with me.  
They listened to me about all my fears and anxieties and did everything they could to make the experience less frightening and upsetting for me.  
From the amazing midwife, the anaesthetist, the other theatre staff (I don't know what their official roles were but they seemed to take on the role of looking after me and my every need), the neonatal staff (especially the amazing doctor who found a way for me to see and hold my baby before he left for NICU) and of course the surgeon (I am so sorry if I left anyone out).  
You were all amazing and I truly appreciate everything you did for us that day.  
Heroes.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Calm & competent
body: There was a waiting list of 80 people this Sunday at Ruh and the waiting room was crazy busy. But the team through the doors were amazing - calm and competent - so impressive. I can’t thank them enough - even the resident barista who made a darn fine cup of coffee. Congrats to all on just being great

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

author: RVS0508
title: Poor care in ICU
body:
In September my husband was admitted to A&E and transferred to ICU where he spent a week before dying. ICU changed their rules about who could be given information about him and who could visit every day. Although I felt they consistently treated me with total disdain despite being his wife of 44 years. We were separated but cared deeply about one another.  
I feel they chose to play God and define us by something that happened in that one week when he was barely conscious. I felt victimised by ICU staff, other people who barely knew my husband had no questions asked or judgements made about them. I found this appalling and all the more so that it was ICU. Apparently it was their compassion which allowed me to be there for his last moments prior to his ventilator being removed. IT was too late and too distressing. My husband died alone and that has had a massive impact on my life.  
My only value seems to have been to collect his death certificate and arrange his funeral. Two long standing friends rang to ask about my husband and no-one even had the courtesy to ask them for their names so he never knew they had expressed any concerns. They too felt they were treated as if they were an inconvenience. At the end of life when I was suddenly allowed in ICU they appeared to feel it was appropriate to regard my husband's brother as his next of kin, despite the fact he has Stage Three Bowel Cancer and had to travel over 400 miles to visit.  
Presumably myself and my brother in law were needed to give approval for the removal of the ventilator. A horrible traumatic experience which no-one should ever have to face. ICU's care in this instance guaranteed my husband died alone as the week progressed.  
Pursuing a complaint has involved liaising with their Patient Experience Team. How hurtful to regard death as an experience. Their response to my complaint itemises my concerns and then ignores some of them. The response has taken two months and has not even been spell checked, and despite it allegedly coming from the Chief Executive no-one has even bothered to add a personal signature.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Iridium is the best practice I have ever been to
body: I love the fact that you can ring in the morning and get a same day appointment either face to face or telephone, it’s your choice. All the staff are kind, helpful and caring and I feel well looked after and confident that my health is in good hands.

title: Quick and easy
body: Very quickly seen and a thorough investigation into my problem, treatment given. The doctor explained things well and was arranging further treatment

title: Very impressed !
body: I walked into the surgery and was met by smiling faces , had an appointment within 2 days . The Dr I saw was incredibly thorough in his examination and questions . I have had tests , and follow up appointments all with same warm approach . The infection I had is now sorted . I was treated with courtesy , kindness and professionalism . Thank you to all the staff !

title: Great practice
body: Not long been with this practice but so far I am very happy with it the staff r very helpful and polite.
